content: Is there a way to set the user name of the new binder when calling MVarId.intro?
The MVarId.intro function takes a name argument, but it seems like this name is inaccessible in hygenic mode
It should be accessible. The intro tactic passes a given name directly to MVarId.intro for example.

Kyle Miller said:

It should be accessible. The intro tactic passes a given name directly to MVarId.intro for example.

but when I queried the assignment of the mvarid that the intro is acting on (i.e. g.intro name and then getExprMVarAssignment? g), the binder introduced in the lambda is anonymous
I found the problem. The name I fed into .intro was from the lambda binding in the value of some Lean library constant (Nat.zero_add) and some of them are anonymous.
Leni Aniva has marked this topic as resolved.
